alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Lapeer; Livingston; Macomb; Oakland; Shiawassee; St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 30 at 5:21AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR SNOW-COVERED ROADWAYS AND REDUCED VISIBILITIES EARLY THIS MORNING... WEATHER... * A burst of snow will impact southeastern Michigan during the early morning hours. * Snow accumulations of around an inch can be expected, especially along the I-69 corridor south to near M-59 between 5 am and 8 am. * South winds around 10 mph with gusts to 15 mph. * Air temperatures will remain steady around 32 degrees. IMPACTS... * Accumulating snow may lead to slippery roads particularly on bridges, exit ramps and overpasses. * Snow will cause reductions of visibility to one mile or less at times. There may be rapid fluctuations of visibility. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * The combination of snow and cold temperatures will result in localized slippery conditions and variable traffic rates throughout the county. Motorists are urged to use caution and account for the variable driving conditions by allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
